sentences: Konrad Ruhland (19 February 1932 â€“ 14 March 2010) was a German musicologist.
He was born in Landau am Inn (Germany/Bavaria)

Under the Ruhland's leadership, a group of enthusiastic students in Munich formed a "Capella Antiqua" in 1956:  known as the Capella Antiqua Munchen, this group was one of the first to tackle the problems of reviving Early Baroque and Renaissance music using a scholarly approach.

Until his death Ruhland continued to communicate his theoretical knowledge and the practical experience to students in numerous courses, music weeks and summer schools, including the summer school at the University of Philadelphia.
